result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:55 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Kaytlyn Jean Hastreiter. Defendant Kaytlyn Jean Hastreiter in court, in custody. Includes 22CM24, 22CM204, 22CM224, and 22CM467. Court reviews case. 22CM467: Speedy trial demanded. All cases: ADA Ballo requests to have JT set on case 22CM467. Atty Selmer was appointed. Court sets STC in  22CM24, 22CM204, 22CM224 and JT and FPT in 22CM467. adjourned 10:14 AM
filed by Travis Satorius; hereby appointing Atty Selmer. kma
Per SJN. fax: Dispatch, Jail, SCSO; ec: DA. kma

INCLUDES 22CM467, 22CM24, 22CM204 and 22CM224 

-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.J.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.
Per SJN. Branch 1 to Branch 2. kma
